alert.note: Alert for Bryan; Bulloch; Candler; Evans (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 30 at 6:52PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bryan, Bulloch, Candler, Evans, Liberty, Long and Tattnall. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 649 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated mostly light rain falling across the warned areas as Tropical Storm Idalia moves across Southeast Georgia. While the risk for flash flooding has ended, many areas remain flooded from earlier heavy rains. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Reidsville, Metter, Glennville, Claxton, Brooklet, Hagan, Collins, Cobbtown, Pulaski, Register, Daisy, Bellville, Manassas, Mendes, Groveland, Nevils, Gordonia Altamaha State Park, Denmark and Georgia Southern.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
